programme.title: Monsieur Dictionnaire
programme.desc: Jacques Mercier explains the origins or meanings behind a French word or expression to Philippe Geluck. For his part, the creator of the cartoon character "The Cat" goes out of his way to set cunning traps for his co-host, and adds his inimitable brand of humorous interjections throughout the programme. Presented by: Philippe Geluck, Jacques Mercier.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Boles de picoulat et crème catalane
programme.desc: Boles de picoulat and crema catalana Jérôme Ferrer, born in the south of France, returns to the recipes of his childhood: boles de picoulat and crema catalana. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 2
Viola begins by offering us a tour of an amazing house, its roof and walls covered by solar panels. Then she visits a surprising home-workshop-studio belonging to an artist-shepherd and a magnificent villa with direct lake access and an owner who is somewhat unusual ... to say the least.
Presented by: Viola Tami. Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Des Français libres, sauver l'honneur
programme.desc:
Between June 1940 and the early days of 1943, the handful of men and women who had gathered around General de Gaulle brought off an impossible gamble: to legitimise an opposition in exile, provide secret services and the beginnings of an army. Their aim: to defeat Nazism and liberate France.

Directed by: Serge Tignères (France, 2020) With Bruno Davézé (de Gaulle)

programme.title: Rocky & Lily : c'est dans la boîte !
programme.sub-title: Le cours de yoga de Rocky
programme.desc:
Rocky's yoga lesson
There's a very Zen ambiance in the studio today: Rocky and Lily are practising yoga, a very fashionable technique, originally from India, that enables the body to achieve complete relaxation thanks to different positions.
Directed by: Angelo Abou Hatem (season 2, Belgium, 2021) With Aurélie Martinez and Romain Angeveld

programme.title: Meurtres en Champagne
programme.desc:
When Madame Dupaquier is found murdered in her own champagne cellars, Inspector Guerini and Constable Delorme head the investigation. Given the labyrinth of tunnels connecting the cellars and the cryptic inscription left by the murderer, they call on Bastien Keller for help. Unfortunately the specialist geologist is currently serving time!

Directed by: Dominique Ladoge (France, 2022)

Screenplay by: Laurence Lowenthal, Olivier Berclaz

Cast: Samira Lachhab (Sofia Guérini), Stéphane Blancafort (Bastien Keller), Yaniss Lespert (Matthieu Delorme), Faustine Koziel (Alice), Christine Citti (Raide), Pierre Hancisse (Vidal)

Genre: thriller

programme.title: Bonne mère
programme.desc:
Nora, a cleaner in her fifties, watches over her little brood on a housing estate in northern Marseille. She worries about what is going to happen to her grown-up son Ellyes, in preventive custody for several months, and awaiting his trial for robbery with a mixture of hope and worry.

Directed by: Hafzia Herzi (France, 2016)

Cast: Halima Benhamed, Sabrina Benhamed, Jawed Hannachi Herzi

Genre: Dramedy

Awards: Official selection for ''Un Certain Regard'' (Cannes 2021)

programme.title: Prémonitions
programme.desc: Episode 5: Rage! Lili tries to find out who followed her into the forest, the evening before, and makes a series of surprising discoveries. Clara goes to check that Pascal is still in hospital and comes across William. Félicia, who's being bullied by the village youngsters, decides to take things in hand. Directed by: Charles-Olivier Michaud (season 1, Canada, 2016) Screenplay: Patrick Lowe, Estelle Bouchard, Charles-Olivier Michaud Cast: Pascale Bussières (Clara Jacob), Sophie Desmarais (Liliane Jacob), Jade Charbonneau (Félicia Jacob), Mikhaïl Ahooja (Arnaud Jacob), Benoît Gouin (Jules Samson), Éric Bruneau (Pascal Deraspe), Liam Patenaude (Romain Jacib) Genre: drama Parental guidance: TV-PG

programme.title: Prémonitions
programme.desc: Episode 6: Stuck in the mud Félicia finally understands the secret of the Jacob family, but still has to face the police. Now that she knows a hunter is on their trail, Clara wants to get away from Beltane. Arnaud can't stand being constantly invaded by Pascal's personality; he'll have to give him his memory back. Directed by: Charles-Olivier Michaud (season 1, Canada, 2016) Screenplay: Patrick Lowe, Estelle Bouchard, Charles-Olivier Michaud Cast: Pascale Bussières (Clara Jacob), Sophie Desmarais (Liliane Jacob), Jade Charbonneau (Félicia Jacob), Mikhaïl Ahooja (Arnaud Jacob), Benoît Gouin (Jules Samson), Éric Bruneau (Pascal Deraspe), Liam Patenaude (Romain Jacib) Genre: drama Parental guidance: TV-PG

programme.title: Destinations
programme.desc: Grasse, the scent of Süskind's bestseller The world capital of roses and perfume, Grasse provides the main décor for Patrick Süskind's novel "Perfume". The most famous author of works dedicated to the intoxication of scent had perhaps retained memories of the time when he once studied mediaeval history in Provence.

programme.title: Connexion intime
programme.desc:
New at the high school, Chloé becomes friends with the charismatic emancipated Luna, and her ex, the seductive but pernicious Félix. Despite his fascination with pornography Chloé falls in love with him, but their relationship rapidly degenerates. One day Félix publishes a sexual video of Chloé on the social media...

Directed by: Renaud Bertrand (France, 2019)

Screenplay: Laure de Colbert

Cast: Luna Carpiaux (Chloé), Marilyn Lima (Luna), Jules Houplain (Félix), Armelle Deutsch (Aurélie), Marius Colucci (Cyril), Julien Pestel (Nicolas), Elodie Navarre (Jeanne), Stéphane Rideau (Marc), Mahia Zrouki (Mélanie)

Genre: drama

Awards: best actress (Luna Carpiaux), 2019 La Rochelle Festival de la Fiction TV

Parental guidance: TV-14

programme.title: Destinations
programme.desc: Sète, a maritime cradle for Paul Valéry A narrow strip of land between the Mediterranean and the Étang de Thau, the town of Sète was the birthplace of Paul Valéry. Its historical districts, crossed by colourful canals and its narrow streets justly earned it the name of the Venice of Languedoc.

programme.title: Académie française, voyage au pays des immortels
programme.desc:
With a touch of self-mockery, journalist and documentary-maker Serge Moati admits his dream of being admitted to the Académie Française. Not (yet) a member, he takes his camera to visit Quai Conti, a building dating back nearly four centuries. History, rites, customs, traditions and codes: the Académiciens reveal their secrets.

Directed by: Serge Moati (France, 2020)

programme.title: TV5MONDE, le journal Afrique
programme.desc: All the African news from the TV5MONDE news staff.
